data.title: Changing AsyncTaskPool/Scheduler to better leverage move semantics
data.body:
Changing AsyncTaskPool/Scheduler to better leverage move semantics. This will allow us to avoid several lambda copy constructor calls, and improve performance in the engine around some of our multi-threading APIs. 

This change should be backwards compatible, and not break current API*. This change should not introduce any additional net copy constructor calls, and should overall reduce the number of copy constructor calls for lambda functions in the engine. 

\* Before AsyncTaskPool::enqueue was based off a generic parameter T, however we were assuming that T implemented operator() accepting no arguments. Internally in the engine, the parameter T could be trivially switched to std::function<void()>. I believe that any users using this code directly should continue to work, unless their lambda's had unused return values for some strange reason.

data.body:

- devices test on: iphone simulator
- developing environments
   - NDK version: NA
   - Xcode version: 8.3.1
   - VS version: NA

Steps to Reproduce:

1. cocos new testproject -l js
2. ./build.sh -p=ios --libs=websockets --arch=i386 --mode=debug
3. copy built websocket libraries to testproject
4. cocos compile -p ios

6. build and run project

data.title: remove APP_SHORT_COMMANDS setting
data.body: some developers report it will cause error on Windows though i can not reproduce it. It is strange, the setting is used to resolve command length limitation on Windows.

data.title: Fix AudioEngine crash on Android
data.body: If call AudioEngine::stop, it'll remove pair from AudioEngine::_audioIDInfoMap with the given audioId, then when use it again on setPlayEventCallback, the AudioInfo with the given audioId is missing, then *AudioEngine::_audioIDInfoMap[id].filePath will result in null pointer exception.

* GCC 4.9
* Cocos2d-x 3.8 and higher

- devices test on: all Android test devices of my company
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r10d
   - Xcode version: 
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Play 3 or 4 audios simultaneously
2. Stop them all and re-play the same audios
3. The crash occurs after repeating several times.

data.title: Fix reschedule issue with same key
data.body:
**The issue:**
* create timer with some repeat count
Scheduler::schedule(callback, target, interval, repeat, delay, paused, key);
* wait for last repeat executed
* in timer callback reschedule it again with the same key
* as result timer is broken and will never be executed

**Reason:**
When we reschedule timer again from callback the scheduler just updates interval value:
`timer->setInterval(interval);`

After callback executed timer will be canceled:
```
if (!_runForever && _timesExecuted > _repeat)
{    //unschedule timer
    cancel();
    return;
}
```

**Fix:**
Scheduler will update interval only for not exhausted timers (still running).
In our case, it will create new internal timer object and old one will be canceled after callback.

The same fix I did for cocos2d-html5 here [https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-html5/pull/3478](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-html5/pull/3478)

data.title: Fix label text wrap
data.body:
Fixed Label text wrap for any language. Tested on English, Ukrainian and Russian.
Previously it worked only for English.

I added one more condition for wrap line - if it's last character in word.

Now it works as expected.
